column3: nit: Rename your Pull Request to `refactor: add small refactor`

Thanks, however these [kinds of refactors generally aren't accepted](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#refactoring), and it's clear you didn't run any of our unit tests before opening this PR. If you're interested in contributing, I'd suggest taking a look at the [good first issue list](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/issues?q=is%3Aopen+is%3Aissue+label%3A%22good+fi

NACK, this doesn't work (see failed arith_uint256_tests in AppVeyor build): uint256 stores the number in Little Endian format, i.e. the most significant byte is at higher address, whereas memcmp would work with Big Endian format, i.e. most significant byte is at lower address.
